name: undeluded
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
believing or understanding what is real or true and not tricked by false claims or common beliefs: A person who is undeluded will know what is beneficial and what is harmful. In the play, he takes a terrifyingly undeluded look at life and human emotions.
More examplesFewer examplesHer ideas were instinctive, passionate, and therefore undeluded by revolutionary discourse.One of the advantages of this type of meditation is that it gives you the ability to face death undeluded. He has remained faithful to the revolutionary cause, undeluded and undeflected from his quest.
